page.title: 11The River Deveron
page.content: The River Deveron separates the two completely different towns of Banff and Macduff. The River Deveron is a very private river as it is a good place to fish for salmon. The Bridge of Alvah, a secluded fishing area, lies 3.5km upstream. Flowing downwards, on the Macduff side of the Bridge, there are a lot of deciduous trees, but as the river meanders along it passes a few conifers. On the Banff side of the river there are fewer trees but much more farmland. The river winds along, causing erosion on its way. As it winds its way to an end it passes by a golf course, and Duff House, and just before the estuary it goes under Banff Bridge.In the estuary there is the keel of a fishing boat which was bombed there during World War II.
